availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin S. Coffey (Adair County, Kentucky, miller)

body.p: Adair County, Kentucky, miller, farmer, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Jane S. Coffey. Married to Elizabeth R. McBeath Coffey on August 9, 1854 in Adair County. Father of George A. Coffey and Carrie T. Coffey. Clerk in Adair County in 1850. Household owned six enslaved persons in Adair County in 1850. Miller in Adair County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Adair County in 1860. Farmer in Adair County in 1863. Served in the 9th Kentucky Infantry (U. S. A.) as quartermaster from November 26, 1861 to June 9, 1862.
